metadata.title: CVE-2013-4739 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description: The MSM camera driver for the Linux kernel 3.x, as used in QualcommInnovation Center (QuIC) Android contributions for MSM devices and otherproducts, allows attackers to obtain sensitive information from kernelstack memory via (1) a crafted MSM_MCR_IOCTL_EVT_GET ioctl call, related todrivers/media/platform/msm/camera_v1/mercury/msm_mercury_sync.c, or (2) acrafted MSM_JPEG_IOCTL_EVT_GET ioctl call, related todrivers/media/platform/msm/camera_v2/jpeg_10/msm_jpeg_sync.c.

criterions.comment: linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-raspi').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-azure-fde: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-fde-5.15').
linux-gkeop: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needs-triage').
linux-gkeop-5.15: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needs-triage').
